thread.title: Samsung Galaxy S8 and LG G6 leaked in new case renders
thread.title_full: Samsung Galaxy S8 and LG G6 leaked in new case renders

title: Samsung Galaxy S8 and LG G6 leaked in new case renders
text:
Samsung Galaxy S8 and LG G6 leaked in new case renders Samsung Galaxy S8 and LG G6 leaked in new case renders By February 18, 2017 “The Galaxy S8 and G6 will flaunt minimal bezels on top and bottom” 
Korean tech giants Samsung and LG are expected to unveil their latest flagships in the coming weeks. The Samsung Galaxy S8 and S8 Plus were leaked in a couple of renders and a 360-degree video recently. The LG G6 was also recently leaked in a couple of live images . Now the popular tipster Evan Blass has posted case renders for the Samsung Galaxy S8 and LG G6, which have revealed details regarding their possible design. 
Talking about the Samsung Galaxy S8’s case render first, it shows the device with a dual-edged curved display and minimal bezels on the top and bottom. In line with the earlier leaks, the phone’s fingerprint sensor has been moved to the rear alongside the camera. The phone appears to have an Iris scanner in the front for facial recognition. The handset appears to have a high screen-to-body ratio. 
As for the LG G6, the case render reveals that the phone will flaunt a metal unibody design. It will have two cameras at the rear with a dual-LED flash, and a fingerprint sensor below it. Similar to the Galaxy S8, the LG G6 will also sport minimal top and bottom bezels, but with a flat screen. The handset appears to be running the latest Android Nougat version.Related read: Rumour zone: what to expect from the LG G6 
LG recently confirmed that the G6 will flaunt a 5.7-inch quad-HD+ FullVision display with UX 6.0 customised to maximise the advantages of the huge screen. The phone is expected to come with a Snapdragon 821 SoC, 4GB of RAM, 32GB of storage, a 32-bit hi-fi Quad DAC and a 3,200mAh battery. It will be unveiled at the brand’s pre-MWC event on February 26th, and we will be there to bring you all the official details. 
As for the Samsung Galaxy S8, the phone is expected to be unveiled at an event on March 29th. The brand has also teased its new Exynos 9 processor, which is expected to power the Indian variant of the Galaxy S8 and S8 Plus. The global variant of the S8 duo will be fuelled by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 835 processor.
